title: An Iran Deal in Two Weeks? Hard to Achieve, Even if Trump Really Wants One.
summary: Negotiating with Tehran is time-consuming and difficult under the best of circumstances. And it remains unclear whether President Trump’s 14-day clock is more than a way to buy time for military preparations.

title: Vance Blames L.A. Violence on California Democrats and Disparages Padilla
summary: Vice President JD Vance said during a Los Angeles stop that Gov. Gavin Newsom and Mayor Karen Bass had encouraged protesters to engage in violence. He also criticized Senator Alex Padilla and called him by the wrong name.

title: Where Trump and Newsom’s Fight Over the California National Guard Stands
summary: A volley of court rulings has made the legal path unclear in a case challenging President Trump’s use of troops in Los Angeles. For now, the president has retained control of the state militia.

title: Dodgers Pledge Aid to L.A. Families Affected by Trump Crackdown
summary: Pressed by Angelenos, including a large Latino fan base, the Dodgers promised support but stopped short of denouncing ICE raids that have outraged much of the metropolis.

title: ‘Justice Will Prevail,’ Mahmoud Khalil Says as He Goes Free on Bail
summary: Mr. Khalil, a Columbia graduate, had been held in Louisiana for over three months as the Trump administration sought to deport him. A judge found reason to believe it was retaliation for his pro-Palestinian speech.

title: How Trump Treats Black History Differently Than Other Parts of America’s Past
summary: Since taking office in January, President Trump has tried to reframe the country’s past involving racism and discrimination by de-emphasizing that history or at times denying that it happened.

title: Barbra Streisand on the Duets That Define Her: ‘I Like Drama’
summary: With a new album due next week that pairs her with Paul McCartney, Bob Dylan, Laufey, Sam Smith and more, the singer looks back at her prized collaborations.

title: UK Heat Wave Leaves Britons Looking for Ways to Stay Cool
summary: As high temperatures have become more common in recent years, some people are adjusting, including by investing in air-conditioners.

title: U.S. Heat Wave Forecast: When High Temperatures Will Affect You
summary: Many places around the country will experience their first significant heat of the year in the next few days. Here’s why it’s so dangerous.

title: Anne Burrell Memorial Service Attended by Food Network Stars
summary: The Food Network chef, who died Tuesday at 55, was remembered in a star-studded service that sent her off with a singalong.

title: Anne Burrell’s Death Is Under Investigation as a Possible Drug Overdose
summary: The city’s medical examiner has not determined a cause, but an internal police document says the TV chef was found surrounded by pills.

title: As N.Y.C. Mayoral Primary Nears, Money Talks as Mamdani Walks
summary: Zohran Mamdani, who is second to Andrew M. Cuomo in the polls, was rebuffed in his bid to raise his spending cap. It did not stop his seven-mile trek down Manhattan.

title: Suspect in Minnesota Attacks Was a Doomsday Prepper, Investigator Says
summary: An F.B.I. agent said Vance Boelter left instructions for his wife in the event of a calamity, according to a court document.

title: Taco Bell’s Crunchwrap Supreme, an Unlikely Muse for Chefs, Turns 20
summary: Twenty years after its debut, Taco Bell’s Crunchwrap Supreme has inspired a legion of dupes with its endlessly adaptable format.

title: Gratitude, Not Envy, Can Save America
summary: Americans experience massive amounts of envy. It has led us to think we lack something, even as our prosperity soars.

title: Candidates’ Shift on Crime Turned the New York Mayor’s Race Upside Down
summary: With “defund the police” still in New Yorkers’ ears, getting traction in the mayor’s race was complicated.

title: People With Severe Diabetes Are Cured in Small Trial of New Drug
summary: Most in a small group of patients receiving a stem cell-based infusion no longer needed insulin, but the drug may not suit those with more manageable type 1 diabetes.

title: How Vera Rubin Telescope Scientists Will Deal With 60 Million Billion Bytes of Imagery
summary: The Vera C. Rubin Observatory will make the study of stars and galaxies more like the big data-sorting exercises of contemporary genetics and particle physics.

title: Pilot Tried To Avoid Turtle in Deadly North Carolina Plane Crash
summary: One other person on board was killed in the June 3 crash in North Carolina and another passenger was severely injured.

title: Lou Christie, ‘Lightnin’ Strikes’ Pop Crooner, Is Dead at 82
summary: A late-1960s throwback to the days of clean-cut teen idols — he called himself “the missing link” — he rode his gymnastic vocal range to a string of hits.
